Posts.Content: Hi   my mouth is horrid too. It's like the roof of my mouth is burnt and my gums are wrinkly!  And that god damn awful taste!!!  I am using mouth wash & floss aswell as a lot of brushing. And food is awful, unless it's got a really strong taste.  Am loving mustard, salt & vinegar crisps, blue cheese & onion.  Also lots of juicy things like grapes and oranges.  I'm not sure what else you can actually do about it though.  Mine usually lasts for about a week after chemo & then it's my eyes that become a problem. Sorry I can't be of much help to you, but do love to have a moan!!  lol x Kate
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: Hi, I had double mastectomy on Friday 20th Dec. I came home the next morning with 3 drains, 2 were removed pretty quickly but I still have the 3rd which will come out tomorrow. It's just the most awful sensation when they pull it out, I did try coughing like suggested but ended up yelling as it snaked its way through me, not because of pain but just the sensation!!! Gross. I've managed to get by by just using paracetamol and ibuprofen so far and hope to continue that way. Mentally....I've had a few wobbles but hey ho. Not liking getting dressed because while the drain is still in I can't wear a bra to put my softies in & although all my friends know what I've had done, I will feel more confident in myself if my clothes fit me better and look more feminine, especially as I have on a couple of cms of hair. My family and friends are truly wonderful and make this all much easier to deal with. I hope u all are having lovely Christmas's and 2014 is a better year for us all. Xxx Kate
Posts.Title: Home today !

Posts.Content: I started chemo in may & had regular periods until Sept then they stopped.  I finished chemo end of Sept. I then started getting the belly ache like u do when you are due on & then 2 weeks ago I had a show. It was old looking blood (sorry to be graphic) & was more like a sneeze in my pants and only for one day.  I  have been told this is my body getting back to normal.  Hope this helps.  X Kate
Posts.Title: periods after cemo

Posts.Content: Hi Gail I found out on Friday that I have stage 3c breast cancer.  Wow what a shock..was so not expecting to be to that. It's been a very tough few days for me, my husband, kids and family. Feel emotionally and physically exhausted.  Today I had blood tests and photos taken & on Friday I have to have ct and bone scans.  After that I have an appointment on 11th June & I think that's when they'll tell me the plan of action.  So scared. Hope to hear from you x
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed.

Posts.Content: Hi Gail how u doing?  I have had a tough one today. Was at hospital for 9:00 & had to have a metal clip inserted in to my lump (which is over an inch in size) so they know where it is. Then had to have a bone scan which was an injection followed by a 3 hour wait, so in those 3 hrs I went for a ct scan which involved a lot of liqued being drunk then another injection whilst being scanned & then back to bone scan dept for the scan.  I came out and cried like a baby all the way home.  I think it's been building up for a few days and today was the day it all boiled over.  Feel miserable and exhausted now & can't even get too close to my boys as I too radioactive! ! Got the rest of the week to myself and start chemo on Tuesday. Petrified! !
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed.

Posts.Content: Hi all I have had 2sessions of fec now (3rd is on Tuesday) & the 2nd week after I get the MOST SORE EYES!!! It is driving me crazy.  They itch & are constantly watering & this has made my eye lids sore now. I've had 4 different lots of drops & creams from docs but nothing is helping. Has anybody else experienced this? If so what do u do about it?  Im worried as my next session is on Tuesday and don't want to get into a continuos state of soreness? Hope to hear from someone soon. Kate
Posts.Title: sore eyes..Anyone else?

Posts.Content: Seasons greetings ladies, I'm  going in for a double mastectomy on Dec 20th, no reconstruction as my blood vessels are not good enough yet.  I would love to hear from anyone who has been or is about to go through this too, & let me know what I can expect.  Obviously it is very near to Christmas Day and I have 3 small boys to deal with.  I would like to have some sort of idea of how im going to be in . movement and pain etc etc. Also how long is it before you start to feel normal again & when you can drive etc. Hope tohear from you soon X KATE
Posts.Title: mastectomy on 20th December

Posts.Content: Thank you for your input, you've been very helpful. I did forget to ask though....do you have drains in when they fit your expander? Oh just to let u know, I had double mx and lymph node clearance in December after all the chemo etc I couldn't have immediate reconstruction. And my expanders will be temp ones. I'm so looking forward to it. The whole 'C' thing almost felt like it happened to a different person, but then when u r going through it u feel completely different from anyone else. I have a good head of hair now, which looks like I just have short hair rather than "I've been poorly" hair and getting some boobies back is another door shut on that whole episode and getting me back to me again. For a long time I could never imagine being 'mentally' where I am now. It was my 40th birthday on Tuesday just gone.......it felt wonderful to have been given the chance to be 40!!! I'm now looking forward to the next decade. Be strong pink sisters xxx
Posts.Title: Expander Implant advice please

Posts.Content: Hi girls, I'm going to hospital on September 15th to have my expander implants implanted. I'm very excited about this but also nervous about what to expect after. How do they feel? Does it hurt when they are filled (skin stretch)? Can you sleep on your front? What do u wear...a bra? Do u still wear your prosthetic too? Would love to hear from anyone who is going through this? Thank you x
Posts.Title: Expander Implant advice please

Posts.Content: Cathy,  sixpence & Alison. .. thank you for your kind words and reassurance.  I feel better now that I have seen that it's hopefully not going to be as bad as I initially thought and will probably be harder mentally than physically.  I hope to hear from you again and wish you ladies out there who also going through this the best of luck and love to you all. Happy Christmas xx Kate
Posts.Title: mastectomy on 20th December

Posts.Content: Hello there. .. I am also 38 & a mum to 3 little'uns. So I know exactly how you are feeling. I am also grade 3 & have IT in my lymph glands. I found this out at the end of May and what a ride I have been on so far. I still keep hoping I will wake up & it's all been some terrible nightmare. I can't tell you its gets better but you just get on with it, what else can you do? I have just had my 2nd chemo session & so far its not been too bad. Like getting over a sick bug for a few days & then general tiredness.  I still have lots of decisions to make & I don't want to HAVE to make any of them really.  I just want my old life back but know I have to move forward. We have to hun...for our babies.  So u have to just grit ur teeth& kick the arse out if it.  Be strong...thinking of u xxKate
Posts.Title: Diagnosed on Thursday

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Just wanted to let u know I finally went for it... my hubby shaved my head yesterday! ! It's actually been quite a relief.  For weeks now I've been gradually going from long thick lovely hair to shorter and shorter and thinner and thinner, until it just looked awful and patchy. It was traumatic actually doing it but it's done now. I was just dragging out the inevitable.  My scalp is super white apart from a brown tan line where my parting used to be & I wasn't sure where to end my foundation!  Within the hour I was in sainsburys buying pink tops. People did stare & I had to resist the urge to glare back at them. Then went to our local pub and introduced everyone to my new look. They were all really sweet & reassuring.  The landlord even laughed at me, which I didn't mind as it was a genuine reaction.  It does feel strange though,  I can feel all the tiny breezes like little tickly bugs & it felt very strange on my pillow last night.  I did find myself automatically reaching for my brush this morning.  Anyway, its one less thing to be worried about now. So if any of u are deciding whether to take the plunge then GO FOR IT!!! Love to u all xx Kate
Posts.Title: well I finally did it! !

Posts.Content: Hi June   thanks for responding to me.  I am not that impressed with the wig I have at the moment & it will be staying in it's cage.  I have 2 more on order and maybe they will be better?  I was just saying to Dee Dee I don't really mind the bald look but I really DO NOT want my lashes and brows to go too. I'm so looking forward to next year & being like you, looking back and remembering this stage.   I am 39 on Monday and for ages now I have been saying "Oh I don't want to be 40"  Now being 40 seems like a fantastic place to be and 50 & 60 & 70etc   Has your hair grown back how it was before, ie colour & texture, or is it completely different? Hope to hear from you again soon   xxKate
Posts.Title: well I finally did it! !

Posts.Content: Hi Diane Congratulations on your plunge!!!  You have put a smile on my face knowing I was not alone that day, coz you feel like your alone. My kids think it's great and keep touching it all the time.   I have one wig already & am waiting for 2 more to be delivered.  I don't know if it's the same where you are but we get to choose 3 but keep 1.  Anyway the one I have at the moment is bloody awful, so I'm not really counting on the other 2 being much better.  The scarf look isn't really doing it for me either, so I think I'll just be Katie K rather than Jessie J.  Am so hoping the eyebrows and lashes don't do a disappearing act.  My eyebrows no longer need plucking and a few of my eye lashes have sort of done a 360 and keep poking me in the eye.  I can handle thinning but think I'll look horrific with a totally hair free bonce & face.   As for the constipation  - well I think I have mastered it now.  Lactulose from the day after chemo & 1 x senna tablet the first night after chemo for 3/4 days.  God after my first chemo I didn't go until day 6.  I was in agony, it was like being in labour but with no gas and air (mind you I did have plenty of gas).  At one point I was crawling across the living room floor coz my tummy was so cramped I just couldn't stand up.  I also spent so long sat on the loo that I had 2 bruises across the back of my legs from the loo seat!!!   Anyway I don't really care about any of it so long as it kicks the sh*t out of the cancer.   I'd better go now, my 3 boys are bellowing at me for something or other & the dog is shaking because of the thunder! It was lovely to hear from you.   Take care xx much love Kate
Posts.Title: well I finally did it! !

Posts.Content: Hi ladies On Tuesday I got given the all clear!!! Absolutely amazing news...I burst into tears of relief and happiness and bounced out of the clinic, feeling on cloud 9. And then after a day or 2 I feel really low & emotional and quite lost. How do you just slot back into your old life. I don't look like I used to or feel how I used to. My old life is still the same and welcoming me back but so much has changed for me. Did anyone else feel like this? Kate
Posts.Title: emotions I really didn't expect

Posts.Content: Hi Gill Just reading ur reply has made me boo again,  but thank you for letting me know that I'm not alone.  It is an anticlimax.  You're just pushed out the door and feel alone. I know there's a lot of support if u want it,  but still. .. I am alive X
Posts.Title: emotions I really didn't expect

Posts.Content: Tracey. .. everything you said "ditto". I don't know what you have been through or who u . But... thank you. You r a lovely lady & I wish I knew u xx
Posts.Title: emotions I really didn't expect
